scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Photographic reproductions of plat maps in Albemarle County and Charlottesville.
NOTE: MS 716 stored in map cabinet.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Plat 1: Lots C-1, C-2 and C-3, a division of Parcel "C", "Georgetown", and C-4, a portion of the land of the University of Virginia, C-3 to be added to the land of the Univ. of Va. and C-4 to be added to C-2; Charlottesville, Dec. 1963.
Plat 2: Physical survey of lot located at N.W. corner 5th St. S.W. and Dice St. shown as Parcel 63 on tax map 29; Charlottesville, Oct. 1965.
Plat 3: Plat showing a survey of J.W. Bagby property; Charlottesville, December 1964.
Plat 4: Plat of the McAllister property on Ware Street in Charlottesville, Virginia show on city tax map 28 as Parcels 251 and 252; March 24, 1964.
Plat 5: Plat showing street line to be established on Rugby Rd. and Gentry La. along property of Paul Saunier Jr. and Jane M. Saunier; Charlottesville, Sept. 29, 1966. [copy faded]
Plat 6: Lots D, E, and F - a redivision of Lot 10 and portions of Lots 9, 8, 11, Block B, Meadowbrook Heights; Charlottesville, Nov. 1966.
Plat 7: Virginia Electric and Power Company, plat to accompany right-of-way agreement; Charlottesville, CH-80-64.
Plat 8: Plat of Lots "A", "B" and "C" on the east side of 7 1/2 Street, S.W. south of Elm Street extended; Charlottesville, Sept. 16, 1963.
Plat 9: Physical Boundary Survey of property known as 903 East High St.; Charlottesville, Sept. 1963.
Plat 10: Plat showing survey of property Garland Estates involved in chancery suit Nightengale against Whiting, et al., located on N. and S. side of St. Rte. 53; Albemarle County, Aug. 24, 1973.
Plat 12: Seminole Square, William Harrison Atwood, Architect, Inc., October 1988.
